intro: Barleria glauca, commonly known as blue barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually blue or purple, arranged in dense spikes. Barleria glauca is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardiness.
